title: 105_hr4182
content: SECTION 1. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. The Congress finds that the Brown v. Board of Education decision was significant, leading to the integration of public schools. Little Rock Nine's admission was a key example. Central High School, a historic landmark, was praised for its beauty. Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas, was designated a national historic landmark in recognition of its role in the civil rights movement and the desegregation of public schools in the South. The purpose of this Act is to preserve and interpret the school's significance for present and future generations. Establishment of Central High School National Historic Site. The Little Rock Central High School national historic site is established as a unit of the National Park System in Arkansas. The Secretary of the Interior will administer the site in accordance with relevant laws. Cooperative agreements can be made with public and private agencies. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with public and private agencies for the Little Rock Central High School historic site. A general management plan must be prepared within 2 years, and educational use should not be interfered with. The Secretary can acquire property within the historic site with consent, and must coordinate with the Little Rock School District to not interfere with Central High School's educational use. SEC. 3. DESEGREGATION IN PUBLIC EDUCATION THEME STUDY. The Secretary is required to prepare a national historic landmark theme study on the history of desegregation in public education within 2 years. The study will identify sites that commemorate key events in the movement for racial desegregation in public education and propose new national historic landmarks. Additionally, the study will explore opportunities for education and research by establishing linkages between identified sites and existing units of the National Park System. The theme study will establish linkages between sites related to desegregation in public education and recommend cooperative arrangements with various entities for preservation and interpretation. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with educational institutions, public history organizations, or civil rights organizations for the preparation of the theme study. The study will be part of the general management plan for the Little Rock Central. The theme study will be prepared in coordination with the general management plan for the Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site to ensure scholarly standards are met. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Such sums as necessary to carry out this Act are authorized to be appropriated.
